meanings.definition: A sharp, abrupt sound, as of two hard surfaces colliding.
meanings.sent1: The clacks of the door shutting echoed through the hallway.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clacks of the dishes as they fell to the floor.
meanings.sent3: The clacks of the typewriter keys were oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: The clacks of the pool balls hitting each other created a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The clacks of the hammer against the nail were loud and clear.

meanings.definition: To make a sharp, abrupt sound.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally clacks her heels on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent2: The branches clacks against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine clacks noisily before starting.
meanings.sent4: His teeth clacks together in the cold weather.
meanings.sent5: The keys clacks loudly as he typed on the keyboard.

meanings.definition: A series of signals sent over a communication system.
meanings.sent1: The clacks from the telegraph machine filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The clacks of the Morse code could be heard across the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The clacks of the computer keyboard were like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The clacks of the train tracks signaled the arrival of the train.
meanings.sent5: The clacks of the walkie-talkie were the only means of communication.

meanings.definition: To communicate using a series of signals.
meanings.sent1: They clacks back and forth using the signal flags.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse clacks to ships in the night.
meanings.sent3: The birds clacks to each other in the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The dancers clacks with their feet to convey the message.
meanings.sent5: The scouts clacks using flashlight signals in the dark.
